reviews.text: Restaurant in a very good location. It could be a lot more as the food is pretty good, but the service is very poor. There were 5 of us, we asked for a table, they replied in a rude way of waiting. Once seated, we had to call 3 waiters to have one of them arrive.

5.5 francs for a double espresso (nespresso pod)
5 francs for a “hot chocolate” which is just an instant packet of kids chocolate powder, we expected it to be real chocolate as we are in Switzerland... also no wifi...

Much to improve on... nice location though

Accessibility:5/5
Design:4/5
Safety: 4/5
Experience:4/5
We have ordered 2 cafe but the bill come with 3 cafe!! I have asked over it they answered that they are not stealing and they haven't give me the money back!!!

Terrible restaurant.  Worse service I have ever had in the 10 years I have lived in Switzerland.   We waited for 20 minutes to get drinks and a waiter.  After I politely asked at the bar for some drinks, I was asked to leave.  So, if you're in  Lausanne to beg for overpriced watered-down drinks, this establishment is your place.  Otherwise, I suggest you take your business elsewhere.

What more can I add? Haha.

I recently celebrated a birthday dinner with my husband at Sky Lounge, and it was the best decision we could have made. The view was absolutely spectacular, and the food and drinks were delightful—gourmet heaven! The ambience of the restaurant, whether outdoors or indoors, was perfect and made our time there truly enjoyable. The staff was exceptionally polite and warm, and their sense of humor added a special touch to our experience.

PS: Please book your table in advance.

Adding some photos for reference.

• Amazing view!! The best rooftop view in Lausanne imho
• The staff is super nice, smiling etc
• I was quite surprised with the dessert (normally you pay more for the view than for the quality of the food but this chestnut dessert was really good! - winter carte though)
Summary: beautiful experience for an afternoon tea with a view :)

Such a friendly and enjoyable service from the staff! Cocktails were delicious, and I can't complain on the typical Savoy/Swiss food. I recommend the Gratin de Crozets (with a bit of salt aside or by requesting adding in some salty pork, pieces of bacon or so)
You will find the best view in this area:) excellent service

Try to go for the outdoor seating as the view is stunning. It is very convenient located close to public transportation and also has ample parking. The only thing missing was that they had limited options for vegetarians - though the staff worked hard to put together options, so thumbs up for the good hospitality.

Nice but not fantastic  . Expensive pizza I ordered 22CHF sausage pizza and barely had few touches of sausage mostly like a Margareta, good view but not spectacular because it is located at the nautical area at harbors
Deserves 4plus 🌟 Top spot in the sunshine even in winter ..nice pizzas and wines

Unfortunately, it was a bad experience! They brought the wrong order. They brought Gambas instead of Shrimps. Forgot salads and french fries.
The manager was in the restaurant, apologized, and instead of changing to the correct meals or having a disount, he did not offer any compensation.
Nice view and good ambiance.
It is a simple pizza place buy the view is nice, prices are cheap and food is good. Recommended if you want to eat quick while enjoying the lake

Lacustre is the best place to eat and have a great time in Lausanne: unbeatable location (on the lake, in Ouchy), relaxed and friendly atmosphere, great staff that makes you feel always welcome! I could not recommend it more! Top of the chart.
Amazing views. Very nice service. I have had their great pizzas and appetizers and it has always been great. Friendly service
Great atmosphere, vues are amazing, would recommend to go for drinks at sunset. Food is also good quality.
Excellent place, food is really good and service is very fast. Staff are very nice but the music is very load. Pets friendly.
Nice place to see the sunset and changing colors by the lake, food and atmosphere are great. Hard to get a table!
Great sports bar to watch any sports attraction like the European Soccer Championship. Good atmosphere. The food was nice but not overwhelming… but you are not coming for the food, aren’t you?
Best value in near Lake proximity. Excellent food and beer selection. Shame about the loud tv but still you are well taken care of. I had a salad with prawns and salmon and it was delicious!!!

We were there to have some drinks and were surprised by happy hour. We stayed to have dinner and were surprised again: the White Horse Burger was very delicious! The meat was medium, the toppings fresh and tasty and the bun was fluffy and cross at the same time! We loved it! The service was outstanding - the young woman did a perfect job and was very kind!
Great food and atmosphere. A lot of beer on tap and realy friendly service.

I was there for a drink and it became my spot. The cocktails without alcohol are one of the best I ever try since I’m in Switzerland. And the burgers amazing.very friendly staff. My friend choose the Mix. There is also kids menus.

A very cozy place, with delicious pastries of all sorts for a very nice breakfast for instance.
The ladies working there are very friendly and helpful.
I love this place.

In a bakery where delights sweetly sing,
Open Sundays, joy to the town they bring.
With staff so friendly, and help at hand,
A rare gem in the area, simply grand.

Espresso that charms, a rich, bold embrace,
Among cakes and pastries, it finds its place.
A haven of warmth, where flavors blend,
Simply delicious, a recommend to send.
Had a delicious raspberry thing, 10/10 so yummy! The lady serving was so sweet and kind as well. Outside has lap blankets. Would definitely return
Do you want to start your day with some good coffe? You found the right place to :-) Friendly staff, a Brazilian vibe and most important of all good quality is what you will find here.
Great food, nice staff and atmosphere. Really really really good lemon meringue tart!

The food and service are very good.
The location along the road, when having diner outside, is less enjoyable.
Nevertheless, it's worth a visit.

The food and service are good. Being relative tall the chairs at the terrace are not that comfortable.
Still worth having a drink or a bite.
Food was ok, the lady who took our order very attentive and nice, the place tho looked under construction around the stairs area. Rooftop area was nice and enjoyable

Nice location and facing the lake, service was good but the food wasn’t as expected. I ordered a cheese burger and it looked great but was served cold specially the buns which felt like they came straight from a fridge and they were not fresh also.
Cielo the best Colombia waiters!!! Alejandra y Jorge from PR!!

Nice place runs by an Italian family they are so friendly and warm welcoming ..the food is so delicious we ordered Napoli pizza and a fish dish both are tasty..the prices is a bit high but its worthy .. we’ll come again for sure 👌🏻

This place is amazing. The decor is breathtaking. Usally the service is exception but this time I went with some friends who were from abroad. We came there because until this day I always had a great time. So we order 4 virgin mojito. Mind you the price is 17 chf which is ok for a luxurious place and service. But they literaly served us some sparkling water, few slices of lime and strawberry sirup and few ice cubes not even crushed ice. I was really disapointed THIS TIME.
True five star afternoon tea! Impeccable professional service and declicious food. Missed coming here! Bravo team Saturday afternoon February 12🙏💙
I think it’s one of the best places. It’s Beau Rivage! Service is really good even though they could be a more pro active to ask you if they can bring you anything else.
Beautiful hotel however bar tender were really rude and honestly wouldn’t recommend to anyone.
Nice setting but very slow service

It's a nice location, nice and friendly service,
But gosh coffee quality could be way better😅 same as food / snack choices.
We asked to lower the music, the bartender refused and ask us to move to the restaurant, the music was so load, like in a club. Beside we were the only clients in the bar. Ironic 😏😏😏

Le Bar is a fantastic Bar/Lounge/Terrace! From delicious Ice Creams to great Cocktais and Finger Food, you’ll find plenty of Options presented by the very friendly Team behind its Operation. Thanks Again! ⭐️
Great staff, delicious cocktails, amazing experience!
Great staff making great cocktails!

Feels like a home away from home & delicious lunch that changes everyday. A fresh approach to how restaurants should be these days… local, fresh, cool !! Especially the owners are amazing Sarah & Marc - recommend it!

In a lively friendly atmosphere and the uncomplicated ambience make this place a great meeting place.
Especially on Saturdays you can have your morning breakfast here until 3 p.m.
I invite you to discover this place.

With a convivial and lively atmosphere and a simple ambience, this end-to-end is an ideal meeting point.
Surrounded by the same thing, you can wait for your little dinner and just 15 hours.
Je vous invite à découvrir ce lieu.

Friendly staff but beginners and not knowing much about the profession just like the boss who doesn't even bother to show them how to do it or greet the customers. Overloaded decoration, disparate and uncomfortable furniture. Beer way too expensive, wine priced right. In short, to avoid.

Establishment recently taken over. Small menu (it's the beginning) but what little is offered is excellent. I recommend the cocktails.  The boards are excellent!   The setting is nice, a small neighborhood bistro with a pleasant atmosphere. Great potential

Great neighborhood restaurant, with a simple and tasty menu, always with a vegetarian option. 😉 🥦🍆🍅
Large selection of non-alcoholic beer and mate, a nice little extra when you want to indulge without going overboard. 🍻
Friendly, family atmosphere with pretty flea market furniture which gives it a unique charm.
Great sports bar to watch any sports attraction like the European Soccer Championship. Good atmosphere. The food was nice but not overwhelming… but you are not coming for the food, aren’t you?
Best value in near Lake proximity. Excellent food and beer selection. Shame about the loud tv but still you are well taken care of. I had a salad with prawns and salmon and it was delicious!!!

We were there to have some drinks and were surprised by happy hour. We stayed to have dinner and were surprised again: the White Horse Burger was very delicious! The meat was medium, the toppings fresh and tasty and the bun was fluffy and cross at the same time! We loved it! The service was outstanding - the young woman did a perfect job and was very kind!
Great food and atmosphere. A lot of beer on tap and realy friendly service.

I was there for a drink and it became my spot. The cocktails without alcohol are one of the best I ever try since I’m in Switzerland. And the burgers amazing.very friendly staff. My friend choose the Mix. There is also kids menus.

A pleasant hotel with a reasonably priced restaurant attached. The room I had was small but pleasant and clean. Most of the staff speak English, and the hotel is just across the road from Lake Geneva.  An interesting addition is that a stay currently comes with a 15 day travel pass for public transport.

October 2023

Everything clean and comfortable
No fridge in room
No water in room
Unfriendly reception
No kettle or coffee machine in room as people have noted
The wifi is very weak - inadequate and for the cost of this hotel. The wifi should be better. Breakfast adequate but expensive for what you receive.
Great hotel.  Great location and view overlooking Lake Geneva.

The location in the Ouchy is absolutely perfect! It's right on the beach boulevard. Reataurants and shops are steps away and so is the metro and lake ferries. The hotel is affordable, the rooms are nice and the staff friendly. Our room had a great view on the Geneva lake. 5/5 stars!

Yes!, it is NOT a fancy hotel with its very retro furniture and moquette on the floor but it's spotless clean and functional! A huge plus is the location: just in front of the lake and from the junior suites the views are impeccable. Service: very friendly and helpful

We enjoyed a Jr Suite on our recent trip to Lausanne. The reception desk personnel are fluent in French and English, at a minimum, and were very helpful. The room itself along with a beautiful view of Lake Geneva was excellent and included a complimentary minibar that was restocked daily, air conditioning, a small balcony, etc. It was by far the best room we stayed in on our two week trip to Switzerland.

The location on Lac Leman is hard to beat. The rooms are also nice, top class, as expected - only few have true lake view, though, and the other directions really aren't THAT special.

The check-in was not the best start - not the best room, quite rigid, didn't feel top class. But the service at the L'Accademia, the in-house restaurant, was nothing short of outstanding. Hats off to Viktor and the crew there - they made us (and our little daughter) feel welcome !
Hard to manage suitcases with steps and revolving door.   No staff available to assist.   Had a great time nevertheless and well worth the cost.  Good value.
My husband and I celebrated our Babymoon here and loved it! Highly recommend the Florissant building. Beautiful hotel, we are already planning our trip back.

The location was perfect - close to the Metro and the lake. The grounds and outside of the hotel are beautiful.

The rooms are a bit small however ours had a nice view of the pool and lake.  There are several areas that could use improvement:  We had to carry our own luggage up the outside stairs.  The room's air conditioner wasn't working so we called the front desk who reviewed the instructions to operate it which we had done correctly. She said someone would be sent up shortly to check. Over an hour later, someone came in only to verify we were correct in how to use the thermostat. We then had to wait 1 1/2 hours for someone else to come repair it. Once repaired it worked however we noticed an on-going noise every 20 seconds when on the High setting.  Adjusting it to the middle setting took care of the sound.

To end on a good note, the breakfast was wonderful and the serving staff were very helpful and friendly.

This hotel is a dream, from the wonderful pool area to the perfect blinds in the room (it‘s absolutely dark in the room), from the breath-taking interior (which is upkept perfectly) to the delicious breakfast - this hotel is the one in a million which you need to visit. Only small downgrade: service personnel seems to be a bit inexperienced. But overall, again, probably the best hotel in Switzerland!

We enjoyed our visit immensely!  Thank you to Isabelle for our fantastic room upgrade. The young man at reception was also exceptional, as was Juliette at the bar.  Our dinner at the Japanese restaurant was delicious and the service was excellent. We both have rated Beau Rivage Palace as our favourite hotel ever.

This hotel is a true masterpiece, a grand hotel in every sense. The service is unparalleled, consistently professional and friendly. The grounds are meticulously maintained, and the rooms, along with the spa and amenities, exude pure luxury. It was an absolute delight to get engaged here, creating our own cherished memories within the storied halls of this renowned hotel.

Beautiful hotel and well appointed amenities.  Would definitely stay here again - highly recommend this hotel.  Only feedback I have is that it would be nice if they did not start taking away the breakfast exactly at the time it is over and instead wait until the people in the breakfast room are done.

Stayed for a short Easter break with my young family. Two conjoining rooms worked well, overall impression of hotel is great, breakfast gave good quality and variety.
Spa is great but should be bigger for the size of the hotel.

We went there 2 people on Saturday, and we had a very pleasant dinner. The waitress was super kind to us at all times. We had one pizza each, and they were very good.
There was no problem with the gluten, and I was surprised, because the pizza was so good and so crunchy that I couldn't believe it was gluten free.
Very Good! The Pizza is amazing!! Just order 1 for share it is delicious!! Good Italian wine too.

The pasta and risotto were good and served very nicely. The chicken in the past teated like not freshly cooked.
The service was great 👍

Wasn't here for at least 2 years and the menu changed drastically. It used to be overwhelming.

It now has delicious pizza napoletana. Most products are homemade and if they aren't, you will be notified on the menu. Love the concept.

We will come again and I am already recommending it to anyone I know.
Lovely restaurant and amazing food and service

I rated it 3 stars because it felt like I stayed in a 3-star hotel. Let me explain why: I ordered a Caesar salad (chf 39.- ) to my room. The concierge asked if I wanted it with bacon or not, and I requested it without bacon. An hour later, they brought a plate with a salad that had bacon. The chicken was obviously cooked in the morning, and it was hard, stale, and cold. Overall, the salad was tasteless, even though it's hard to make a bad Caesar salad. The experience at the sky bar was also disappointing. We ordered Ratatouille for chf 35.-, and the dish was just bland. I also want to note that the breakfasts are quite modest.
In a European city renowned for its hospitality industry, like Lausanne, it is “no-go”.
I suspect there are issues with the hotel's kitchen.
The indoor swimming room room was dirty, with food scraps under the loungers. You can't help but notice this when swimming in the pool.
The staff is numerous, but they forget your requests as soon as they walk away from the table.
The hotel room itself was good, the bed was comfortable, the pillows were nice, and the climate control worked. So, if you don't visit the restaurants or eat at the hotel, the impression will be fine.

A luxury hotel with great service and very nice rooms, many with balconies that view the grounds or the main path through Lausanne. The interior of the main building is special and spectacular. The board and meeting rooms are spacious and well appointed. The sleeping rooms are well appointed and intelligently designed. Always a pleasure when getting to stay here. A short walk to the port and only two stops on the tram to the train station.

Very friendly & helpful staff from the check-in until check-out. They upgraded us to a lake view room since we are lhw member.
Decent breakfast buffet with plenty of choices. The spa is also nice and clean.

Points to be improved:
- the pressure for the shower is very weak and the door can’t be close properly so it gets wet outside the shower.
- the temperature of the pool could be 1-2 degree higher

Just returned from an exceptional experience at the Royal Savoy Lausanne! My daughter and I felt like royalty here. It's rare to have an experience where every single encounter stands out, this hotel wrote the book on consistency! The hotel itself is quiet elegance everywhere you look: the lobby, restaurants, rooms, spa, pool! It was soooo comfortable. But the biggest standout were the staff, from our check in experience with Matteo, his greeting (after we had just done a long haul flight from Canada) was perfection, to everyone at the front desk there after, as well as the room attendants, the room service staff were so pleasant upon delivery, as well as the the spa. The biggest standout were the concierge team, they were ALL incredible, we happen to have more encounters with our new friends Giordano and Loris. I have never had concierge service like this!! These guys treated us like we had been good friends for years, offered us very helpful guidance, checked in and asked how our trip was going and actually are a part of our story when we tell family how this trip was. If you are lucky enough to stay at this wonderful hotel, make sure to befriend the concierge staff, they were all above and beyond helpful and memorable!!

Oh and make sure to have a dinner at their Sky Lounge, you will not be disappointed and trust the dining choices of the concierge, we were blown away from their other picks as well!

In almost every part of the hotel the street and hotel noise is present. I was in a garden facing room initially, it faces the road and none of the doors are sound proofed. You can hear banging in the other rooms, banging from doors and not sure what else. I felt like my balcony was shaking. The lovely staff tried to accommodate me to another part of the building, also faces a road. There’s another part of the hotel facing a garden but you can still hear all the noise from the other rooms. No views of the lake in any rooms I was offered. But you can clearly see that ‘lake facing’ rooms face the road anyway (and you’re quite a way from the lake, much closer to the road).
Considering how beautiful this area is and the cost of this hotel, I struggle to find value here.
There are skiff marks all over the furniture in the rooms, my first room wasn’t clean there were cobwebs on the windows and glass marks and grease marks on the table.
The furniture and decor is rather shoddy, dark grey and almost with an air of oppressive sterility, which is misplaced seeing as this is clearly not aiming to be a business hotel.
Reception staff are lovely and helpful, unfortunately I think they must be on commission or some kind of pressure to upsell clients to upgrade their rooms. I’ve been here over 20 times for dinner/drinks/conferences and you always hear them trying to sell upgrades to rooms. And the same was my experience here as a guest.
What a contract to the Savoy in London, which is first rate.
Excellent small Japanese restaurant. Great sushi, bento boxes and main dishes for sitting in and taking away. Everything is super fresh and tasty!

We order via UberEATS.
Unfortunately not all of their items are with Fotos on UberEATS but thanks to their menu on their website we could get an idea of what to expect.
We ordered the Taurus deluxe and in addition salmon and avocado rolls.

The second was not really surprisingly good, but the overall quality of the Sushi was pretty good.
We did receive a slight variation of Nigeris than what was on the picture on their website, but overall a solid option.

Everything came with homemade wasabi and some ginger (which could have been more).
Amazing food, friendly staff, ordered sushi and chicken ramen
A little whole in the wall and my Japanese sanctuary 🙏🏼. Food very yummi: bibimbap, bento box, terriyaki... It's always fresh and home made. I chose mostly to go.
Great home made traditional sushi. Great lunch and poke bowls as well!

It was an amazing experience at this restaurant located close to the Leman Lake ! I went with some friends and we had some delicious pasta and bruschetta. They had many sort of it and a lot of type of pizza and others italian specialties. Everything looks fabulous and I’d recommend it to everyone !
We had a great experience, Pinocchio tagliatelle (photo) was delicious. The owner, Mr. Okkes was very friendly and spoke English very well.
Very nice place! Great food and amazing service. Tiramisu is a MUST
Nice cosy place, recently (january 2024) taken over by a  nice couple. They pay attention to customers and do their best to satisfy requests. Food is simple, but served quick.
Had a fantastic evening with friends,  everything we ordered was fantastic, and the service was first class.

I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom’s to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the restaurant Café Beau-Rivage at the hotel of the same name in Ouchy, Lausanne. Nested across the lake shore, the restaurant is equally pleasant either its food options. Highly recommended if in Lausanne.

Top 5 dinner ever.  We were staying at the hotel and someone at the pool recommended it.   Sat outside looking at the lake.  Very pretty setting.  Everything was perfect.  The service was friendly and on point.  The food was perfection.   I started with a burrata and tomato salad and it was fantastic.   On the menu there was an option to add truffles to another dish and I asked if I could add it to the salad and they said of course.   And it was so good!   For an entree I had perch, a local favorite.  About 10 filets, lightly breaded and grilled in butter.  It was fantastic.  Dessert was the highlight.   It was an orange soufflé, but cold and made from an ice cream like texture.  The waitress paired it with a dessert wine and it may be the best dessert I’ve ever tasted.  Everything was so elegant.  I would come back to Lausanne just to eat here again.

We had a wonderful experience. Everything was just incredible, super-kind staff, amazing food, and special Christmas decorations.

We took the long way in, through the hotel lobby.
* Two adults, two kids age 5 and age 1.5
* There is an extensive kids menu.
A restaurant accessible through park next to the lake. Appetizers were good. Main course overall was so so. Fish dish was better than beef or lamb. Prices was high.

The cafe is a wonderful place to have lunch. Also, just walking through this majestic building and absorbing all the art and intricate building details is very plleasing.

As to the cafe, the service is impeccable by the staff and a pleasure to enjoy.
As to the meals, we have a mixed opinion. As we are vegetarians, we contacted the restaurant in advance, and we agreed on two types of salads as starter and either tortellini or gnocci as main dishes.

The food was wel presented as can be seen from the photos. However, the salad with the orange pieces was quite bitter and not to my taste. With a table partner, we swapped the salads, and luckily, the green salad with parmigiano was well seasoned and tasted delicious.

I had the tortellini dish, and while the cheese tortellini was good, the combination with a bitter vegetable and a lot of lemon sauce overpowered the tortellini totally. It was not really enjoyable.

On the other hand, the persons who had taken the gnocci were very complementary and happy with their dish.

First time here but we will definitely come back. We enjoyed our shabu Shabu which was served with many vegetable and meat and noodles. Everything was delicious. We also had shrimp tempura which was delicious. For desert I had the green tea mochi which was a great way to end a great meal. Service was fast and very friendly. We will be back to try the sushi which looked brilliant!

Incredibly fresh sushi and fast service. There are not a lot of selections but finding sushi this fresh in the middle of the Europe is amazing. Order the boat for two, comes with a lot extras, it is worth the price.
Very nice lunch sets and great tempura. The service was very friendly.
Very nice Japanese. Lovely quality with very nice sushi. Super nice wine selection as well. All fresh ingredients and nice taste. Friendly and attentive staff. Reasonable prices. Great.

The reception was very friendly including the service. The restaurant is fairly accessible also for disabled. All food was tasty and well plated and arrived in reasonable time. We will return next time in Lausanne.

Best Lebanese food ever. Top notch food and service.  Such a wonderful experience visiting this gem in Lausanne. Ayman was so delightful and courteous host. The owner John Pierre is absolutely wonderful and kind. This is my favorite food spot in Lausanne by far.

One of the best Lebanese food restaurants in the world! I am a lebanese foodie and every bite of their food reminded me of Lebanon! Everything was delicious and very well cooked!  The staff are extremely friendly and you feel surrounded by family love!
Highly recommended for everyone staying in the area and looking for some amazing Lebanese food experience!

Wow!! This place is fantastic! We ordered a six course meal but the dishes just kept coming and coming. Each dish was so flavorful and authentic and the format allowed us to try almost everything on the menu. The food was very fresh and you can tell a lot of care goes into each item on the menu. If you are looking for authentic Lebanese food in an intimate setting, this place is perfect! They were also very accommodating of my tomato allergy which is not always an easy thing to do.

Excellent food. Excellent service.

We will definitely be back next time we are in town. 💜
Excellent expérience, food and service were amazing !! The hummus is exquis! I recommend this to all the food lovers out there ! NOM NOM NOM

Can you give 0 stars?
They brought us some parsley and cold bread (how are you supposed to eat these 2?) nothing else came, after 30min we went inside to tell the waiter that we had to leave so they could prepare the food to take away..they hardly understand EN, they said okok but nothing came. After some min we went inside again and got nothing more that what u see in the pic and paid 40CHF for it. Shame!!

This is one of the first restaurants I visited when I first arrived in CH...and my go-to place since then. Their menu offers a  variety of crepe options--from savory to sweet choices!  Serving size is really big. Staff are super friendly and accommodating! A must try when you are in Lausanne!

Amazing selection of salty or sweet crepes. Of course we had to try both and didn’t get disappointed.
The service was very friendly and the view by the lake stunning.
Great place by the water.  They have gluten free buckwheat savory crepes that are so good you can't stop eating.  Wonderful artisanal gluten free cider goes perfectly with the crepes.

The door is always open and therefore it does get a bit cold… Also there is only one bathroom for each gender which isn’t really sufficient. Nevertheless, the restaurant is quite small and cozy with very delicious crepes which you can either personalize or select from premade options.
Omg the best crêpes ever... salt and sweet both were delicious and also the milkshakes were great.. great service.. clean toilets.. nice place near lake.. 👍🏽❤️

Restaurant in a very good location. It could be a lot more as the food is pretty good, but the service is very poor. There were 5 of us, we asked for a table, they replied in a rude way of waiting. Once seated, we had to call 3 waiters to have one of them arrive.

5.5 francs for a double espresso (nespresso pod)
5 francs for a “hot chocolate” which is just an instant packet of kids chocolate powder, we expected it to be real chocolate as we are in Switzerland... also no wifi...

Much to improve on... nice location though

Accessibility:5/5
Design:4/5
Safety: 4/5
Experience:4/5
We have ordered 2 cafe but the bill come with 3 cafe!! I have asked over it they answered that they are not stealing and they haven't give me the money back!!!

Terrible restaurant.  Worse service I have ever had in the 10 years I have lived in Switzerland.   We waited for 20 minutes to get drinks and a waiter.  After I politely asked at the bar for some drinks, I was asked to leave.  So, if you're in  Lausanne to beg for overpriced watered-down drinks, this establishment is your place.  Otherwise, I suggest you take your business elsewhere.

First time here but we will definitely come back. We enjoyed our shabu Shabu which was served with many vegetable and meat and noodles. Everything was delicious. We also had shrimp tempura which was delicious. For desert I had the green tea mochi which was a great way to end a great meal. Service was fast and very friendly. We will be back to try the sushi which looked brilliant!

Incredibly fresh sushi and fast service. There are not a lot of selections but finding sushi this fresh in the middle of the Europe is amazing. Order the boat for two, comes with a lot extras, it is worth the price.
Very nice lunch sets and great tempura. The service was very friendly.
Very nice Japanese. Lovely quality with very nice sushi. Super nice wine selection as well. All fresh ingredients and nice taste. Friendly and attentive staff. Reasonable prices. Great.

The reception was very friendly including the service. The restaurant is fairly accessible also for disabled. All food was tasty and well plated and arrived in reasonable time. We will return next time in Lausanne.

A pleasant hotel with a reasonably priced restaurant attached. The room I had was small but pleasant and clean. Most of the staff speak English, and the hotel is just across the road from Lake Geneva.  An interesting addition is that a stay currently comes with a 15 day travel pass for public transport.

October 2023

Everything clean and comfortable
No fridge in room
No water in room
Unfriendly reception
No kettle or coffee machine in room as people have noted
The wifi is very weak - inadequate and for the cost of this hotel. The wifi should be better. Breakfast adequate but expensive for what you receive.
Great hotel.  Great location and view overlooking Lake Geneva.

The location in the Ouchy is absolutely perfect! It's right on the beach boulevard. Reataurants and shops are steps away and so is the metro and lake ferries. The hotel is affordable, the rooms are nice and the staff friendly. Our room had a great view on the Geneva lake. 5/5 stars!

Yes!, it is NOT a fancy hotel with its very retro furniture and moquette on the floor but it's spotless clean and functional! A huge plus is the location: just in front of the lake and from the junior suites the views are impeccable. Service: very friendly and helpful

Fantastic experience in this hotel. The location is wonderful. Reception team was great with answering my questions. The room was also great, clean and well maintained. Very nice view on the lake. Woow, the breakfast was also great and the bar has a great atmosphere and the restaurant served very good food with a large choice. What I appreciate the most, is the service , great customer service , always smiling, welcoming and a kind Word.  Thank you and will come back again surely!!!!

Amazing and relaxing stay!
The staff was super friendly and welcoming, with so many little attentions to make us feel welcomed (chocolate, very cute bed for my baby as well as baby soap and shampoo). The room had an incredible view and was very quiet which made us feel so relaxed, exactly what we needed. Finally the hotel is perfectly located by the lake and close to the tube to reach the city center, it was very easy to move around and discover Lausanne. We would definitely come back and recommend it!

This hotel has a great location, great views and really good service with a friendly staff. It is across from the marina with a really nice view of the lake and the Alps in the distance. It is less than 5 min walk from the train station and about 10 min walk from the Olympic Museum and Park. The food was quite good and the ice cream, which Movenpick is known for, was great. A really good choice for a hotel!

During my recent stay at the Mövenpick Hotel Lausanne, I found it to be a generally delightful experience, with a few small areas that could use improvement.

The location is absolutely stunning, offering breathtaking views of Lake Geneva and the surrounding mountains. It's also conveniently located, making it easy to explore the beautiful city of Lausanne.

The staff were consistently courteous and helpful, making check-in and check-out processes smooth and ensuring that any questions or needs were promptly addressed. Their dedication to providing excellent customer service was very much appreciated.

The room, while not particularly spacious, was convenient and perfect for a short stay. It was well-equipped with all the necessary amenities for a comfortable experience. However, I did notice that while the general cleanliness was satisfactory, it was not spotless. There were minor details, such as dust in less obvious areas and some bathroom fixtures that could have been cleaner.

The hotel's dining options were impressive, with a good variety of delicious dishes available. The dining area itself was spacious and comfortable. However, there was one notable issue at the live cooking station during breakfast. Unfortunately, the chef on duty was not pleasant or friendly and was, in fact, quite rude to a 15-year-old guest. This incident was disappointing and contrasted with the otherwise positive atmosphere of the hotel.

Overall, the Mövenpick Hotel Lausanne is a lovely place to stay, offering comfort and a prime location. With a bit more attention to cleanliness and some improvements in staff training, particularly for the live station chef, it could elevate the guest experience even further. I would certainly consider staying here again in the future.

The hotel is overall a very clean and the staff are friendly. That helps quite a lot. However the room comfort was not up to standard quality. It was below quality in my opinion. The air conditioning unit barely was blowing any form of air. You can sense something is coming out of the vents, however it's so slight that you really can't feel it overall in the room. I went to open the window to have some ventilation and air, however there were a lot of mosquitos every where. I requested a fan of which I received and I'm honestly thankful they did have it (I was considering buying one). So, I used the fan every night before I went to sleep to get some circulation of air into the room, so that solved the problem to an extent. As for the bathroom experience, it was overall fine and clean. However I had to deal extreme cold and hot temperatures at the same time. The water temperature kept fluctuating from extreme to extreme. After a while, I managed to find a pattern and stuck with it. Furthermore, the water pressure was very low, which meant I had to stay in the shower a bit longer than usual. The bed was very comfortable. I accepted that in the end, considering the rate I was paying was quite low, I accepted all the faults that I experienced. I didn't complain to the hotel. I didn't want to make a big issue out of it. I just was glad the checkout day came and that experience won't continue. If there's any recommendation I would give to the hotel, it would be to please stay in such rooms for a week and see how you feel in the end of it. Then, at least you will know which areas to improve.

My room was lovely.  The breakfast was great.  Our only problem was that the hotel was to have made dinner reservations for us for two nights.  The restaurants did not have reservations for us either night.

Our stay was wonderful and seamless! The staff is professional, polite, and very friendly. The location is magnificent and rooms are very well maintained and organized. Excellent service throughout the hotel and resturant. We most certainly recommend to all seeking a peaceful and seamless stay in Lausanne.

Everything was very nice. However, the doors and the floors/ceilings are not well sound proofed. We could hear people passing in the hallway and above our room there were guests making a lot of noise in one of the mornings, waking us up super early (before 8 am) when we were really looking forward to sleeping in. Other than that, all good!

Not my first stay. But I understand not all rooms are to same standard. When I get into the room, I saw 2 ants in the bathroom. But I saw no harm. But I woke up with one on my face and 2 in the bed. In the morning reception made a note and said to be informing housekeeping. When I arrive back to the room in teh afternoon, this time there was a large group of ants in my room & bathroom. My room was changed. I am sure housekeeping & reception did their best but it was not impossible that housekeeping did not notice them.

the room I was moved was not maintained in the same level as others. The light in the bathroom was not working.

I also eat dinner in the hotel restaurant for the first time. The service was incredibly slow and it took quite an effort to attract attention from the waiters.

Given the price/value level, one do not expect these.

We had a wonderful stay in the junior suite.  The bellboy, concierge, check in was seamless and the staff very friendly and kind.  It is unfortunate the hotel has in charge at the breakfast bar on 2nd June 11am such a dismissive and rude employee to customers trying to order a cup of hot chocolate and coffee.  Instead of acknowledging she has received the order, she says she is coming and proceeds to take her time to chat with the other customers after serving them their coffee, after a while we approached her and she responded by giving us a dirty look and still said she’s coming, as if we are bothering her chatting away.  It was clear her behavior towards us was with ill intent else she would not have been eventually arguing and aggressively reacting to us leaving.  Her demeanor is not coherent to the rest of the hotel staff whatsoever, unfortunately it has made our stay less pleasant than we were enjoying.

We enjoyed a Jr Suite on our recent trip to Lausanne. The reception desk personnel are fluent in French and English, at a minimum, and were very helpful. The room itself along with a beautiful view of Lake Geneva was excellent and included a complimentary minibar that was restocked daily, air conditioning, a small balcony, etc. It was by far the best room we stayed in on our two week trip to Switzerland.

The location on Lac Leman is hard to beat. The rooms are also nice, top class, as expected - only few have true lake view, though, and the other directions really aren't THAT special.

The check-in was not the best start - not the best room, quite rigid, didn't feel top class. But the service at the L'Accademia, the in-house restaurant, was nothing short of outstanding. Hats off to Viktor and the crew there - they made us (and our little daughter) feel welcome !
Hard to manage suitcases with steps and revolving door.   No staff available to assist.   Had a great time nevertheless and well worth the cost.  Good value.
My husband and I celebrated our Babymoon here and loved it! Highly recommend the Florissant building. Beautiful hotel, we are already planning our trip back.

The location was perfect - close to the Metro and the lake. The grounds and outside of the hotel are beautiful.

The rooms are a bit small however ours had a nice view of the pool and lake.  There are several areas that could use improvement:  We had to carry our own luggage up the outside stairs.  The room's air conditioner wasn't working so we called the front desk who reviewed the instructions to operate it which we had done correctly. She said someone would be sent up shortly to check. Over an hour later, someone came in only to verify we were correct in how to use the thermostat. We then had to wait 1 1/2 hours for someone else to come repair it. Once repaired it worked however we noticed an on-going noise every 20 seconds when on the High setting.  Adjusting it to the middle setting took care of the sound.

To end on a good note, the breakfast was wonderful and the serving staff were very helpful and friendly.

This hotel is a dream, from the wonderful pool area to the perfect blinds in the room (it‘s absolutely dark in the room), from the breath-taking interior (which is upkept perfectly) to the delicious breakfast - this hotel is the one in a million which you need to visit. Only small downgrade: service personnel seems to be a bit inexperienced. But overall, again, probably the best hotel in Switzerland!

We enjoyed our visit immensely!  Thank you to Isabelle for our fantastic room upgrade. The young man at reception was also exceptional, as was Juliette at the bar.  Our dinner at the Japanese restaurant was delicious and the service was excellent. We both have rated Beau Rivage Palace as our favourite hotel ever.

This hotel is a true masterpiece, a grand hotel in every sense. The service is unparalleled, consistently professional and friendly. The grounds are meticulously maintained, and the rooms, along with the spa and amenities, exude pure luxury. It was an absolute delight to get engaged here, creating our own cherished memories within the storied halls of this renowned hotel.

Beautiful hotel and well appointed amenities.  Would definitely stay here again - highly recommend this hotel.  Only feedback I have is that it would be nice if they did not start taking away the breakfast exactly at the time it is over and instead wait until the people in the breakfast room are done.

Stayed for a short Easter break with my young family. Two conjoining rooms worked well, overall impression of hotel is great, breakfast gave good quality and variety.
Spa is great but should be bigger for the size of the hotel.

1st floor room come with spacious balcony. Comes with 2 complimentary waters inside the fridge. Love the furnitures in the room and nice wallpaper.

There is one part of the carpet in front of the bathroom is wet for some reason. It is also not possible to adjust the heating as the system is centrally control, there are night where it’s quite cold. The pillow is too soft for me personally.
overall, the stay was OK, the hotel is really old. Need to be renovated. And the room is really old and many things were not working. The bed is good. you have to pay for the parking.

We stayed here for about a week last summer. It's a gorgeous property with very nice rooms. The rooms are lavishly decorated and equipped with air conditioning, if you need it. Each room comes with a balcony/terrace. Rooms on the first/second floor (the floor above ground level, it depends where you're from) have access to a much larger terrace which was a welcome surprise.

The elevator is quite small, but it's a historic building so it was expected.

Staff are very polite and were keen to offer directions or recommendations, and readily provided free transit passes for tourists from the city.
The location is great as it's just a few minutes from a metro stop, which makes the rest of the city very accessible as well, thanks to Lausanne's excellent public transit system.

Overall, an excellent hotel to spend a romantic escape for two, in one of Europe's finest cities.

Charming historic hotel walking distance from both the main train station and the lake. I like that the windows open, but am generally not a fan of carpeting in the hotel rooms. They opened breakfast early for a few of us that had an early start, and the tea kettle in the room was a nice touch. Nice little hotel in Laussane.

We had a wonderful stay at this nice hotel. The situation is perfect (10 minutes from the station, 10 minutes from Ouchy) and we loved this boutique hotel which kept the charme of a classic hotel. We wish to express our thanks to Laetitia at the reception who was very friendly and allowed us to change the date of our stay. We will surely come back!
Very nice staff. They gave me back (for free) the goods I lost because my bag brocks while going out of the store
In times of Covid I appreciated the fact that this store is very spaceous, especially at the entrance.
Has a large selection of everything you might need, even some house hold items and childrens' books.
Little, clean, enough for me.
Good place to get your daily groceries. A little bit of everything.

I’m a 2007 MBA and came back in 2010 for the Executive Advanced Strategic Planning course. IMD MBA changed my life and opened many doors for me to enter the business world. I’m able to retire at the age of 47 thanks to IMD and the trainings I received.

IMD in Lausanne stands out as one of the premier learning institutions I have experienced. The incorporation of gamification and a point system significantly enhances the learning process, making it both engaging and effective. The faculty, comprising highly competent coaches and professors, demonstrates exceptional expertise. Having attended numerous institutions, I can confidently assert that IMD is among the finest. I highly recommend it for those seeking excellence in business education.
Very good business school, would highly recommend. Location (near lake Geneva) is magnificant and supports the experience.

Had the best time and course in here
Met some really amazing people
IMD is absolutely fantastic.

I have received a 76 page brochure from you - that I have NOT requested and have no interest in.  You have wasted paper sending me a brochure I do not want or need and you sent it by UPS - marked Extremely Urgent which I imagine means airfreight. The irony is that the brochure heading is 'Sustainability Transformation' - I think you may need to look at your marketing strategy if you want to attract people who are committed to a Sustainability Transformation. Please remove me from your distribution list - that will at least save some paper and reduce some carbon emissions.  Thanks, Charlotte Fenton

I loved my time at the Olympic museum. The exhibits had something for everyone and the videos were so well made. My fav section was the medals display. How cool is it that you’re able to see the actual medals from every single Olympic Games! With Paris 18 days out, the section for the games with the torch, medals, mascots was amazing. The final cool aspect is that this is included with the Swiss pass 🙂

Visiting the Olympic Museum in Lausanne, Switzerland, was an exceptional experience. The museum beautifully captures the spirit and history of the Olympic Games, offering a fascinating journey through time. From the extensive collection of memorabilia, including medals, torches, and athlete uniforms, to the interactive exhibits that engage visitors of all ages, every detail is meticulously curated.

One of the most impressive aspects is the immersive multimedia presentations that bring the stories of past Olympic Games to life. The museum also features insightful displays on the cultural and social impacts of the Olympics, highlighting the event's global significance.

The stunning location by Lake Geneva and the beautifully landscaped gardens add to the overall charm of the visit. The Olympic Museum is a must-see for sports enthusiasts and anyone interested in the history and ideals of the Olympic movement. An inspiring and unforgettable.

Definitely worth going when you are in Lausanne. So much great information and history.  The nurse I’m is beautiful and right by the lake. It has a gift store and a wonderful restaurant for lunch and brunch.
If you go in the spring, do not miss the beautiful magnolia trees, cherry blossoms and spring flowers.

This is a must-visit for any sports fan or history buff. It houses the world's largest collection of Olympic memorabilia, with exhibits that take you through the history of the Games from ancient Greece to the present day.
You can see Olympic torches, medals, and equipment from famous athletes, and even test your own athletic skills in interactive displays.

After visiting it you can just walk down and stroll  on the banks of lake Geneva.
Highly recommended

Certainly we enjoyed our visit to the museum! A fascinating place with so much history to explore. The permanent exhibition on Olympic athletes, architects, and others are quite interesting. And seeing the Olympic game medals dating back to 1896 is indeed very impressive!

Highly recommended to visit this museum when you're in Lausanne.
Very grateful to the trauma emergency team, especially Dr Nicolas Teboul.  Everything was very fast and the treatment was excellent from all the staff.  Thank you!

Fantastic clinic. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I had broken and dislocated a toe and was seen right away after a quick phone call. The fact this was all on Sunday was even more impressive. Great facilities, very well looked after, and was immediately at ease. Everyone spoke English which was an added bonus for me who is still learning French. Extremely grateful and would recommend to anyone needing emergency care.

I definitely recommend this medical centre.
The staff is caring, kind and well prepared.
I underwent leg surgery and stayed for two nights. The installations are modern and well maintained. Starting with the arrival passing by the intervention to the medical discharge, the details are well thought out for the patients and their visits. Everything was clearly explained. From the reception to the medical staff and ending with the janitor, the attitude is of genuine care and excellence in what they do. The building is close to the centre of Lausanne, with some views showing the mountains. It is a private hospital, but it feels like a cosy well-managed 5-star hotel from the reception to the rooms and food preparation.
Thank you for your service and care!
I won't say that I would like to return, but If I need to, I will =).

Physiotherapy center of the Clinique Bois Cerf.

Modern equipment and very professional staff.
Perfect

Very well created website.
Very easy to use.
Well done !!!
Great team 👍😃
Very beautiful

A pleasant hotel with a reasonably priced restaurant attached. The room I had was small but pleasant and clean. Most of the staff speak English, and the hotel is just across the road from Lake Geneva.  An interesting addition is that a stay currently comes with a 15 day travel pass for public transport.

October 2023

Everything clean and comfortable
No fridge in room
No water in room
Unfriendly reception
No kettle or coffee machine in room as people have noted
The wifi is very weak - inadequate and for the cost of this hotel. The wifi should be better. Breakfast adequate but expensive for what you receive.
Great hotel.  Great location and view overlooking Lake Geneva.

The location in the Ouchy is absolutely perfect! It's right on the beach boulevard. Reataurants and shops are steps away and so is the metro and lake ferries. The hotel is affordable, the rooms are nice and the staff friendly. Our room had a great view on the Geneva lake. 5/5 stars!

Yes!, it is NOT a fancy hotel with its very retro furniture and moquette on the floor but it's spotless clean and functional! A huge plus is the location: just in front of the lake and from the junior suites the views are impeccable. Service: very friendly and helpful

Fantastic experience in this hotel. The location is wonderful. Reception team was great with answering my questions. The room was also great, clean and well maintained. Very nice view on the lake. The museum beautifully captures the spirit and history of the Olympic Games, offering a fascinating journey through time. From the extensive collection of memorabilia, including medals, torches, and athlete uniforms, to the interactive exhibits that engage visitors of all ages, every detail is meticulously curated.

One of the most impressive aspects is the immersive multimedia presentations that bring the stories of past Olympic Games to life. The museum also features insightful displays on the cultural and social impacts of the Olympics, highlighting the event's global significance.

The stunning location by Lake Geneva and the beautifully landscaped gardens add to the overall charm of the visit. The Olympic Museum is a must-see for sports enthusiasts and anyone interested in the history and ideals of the Olympic movement. An inspiring and unforgettable.

Definitely worth going when you are in Lausanne. So much great information and history.  The nurse I’m is beautiful and right by the lake. It has a gift store and a wonderful restaurant for lunch and brunch.
If you go in the spring, do not miss the beautiful magnolia trees, cherry blossoms and spring flowers.

This is a must-visit for any sports fan or history buff. It houses the world's largest collection of Olympic memorabilia, with exhibits that take you through the history of the Games from ancient Greece to the present day.
You can see Olympic torches, medals, and equipment from famous athletes, and even test your own athletic skills in interactive displays.

After visiting it you can just walk down and stroll  on the banks of lake Geneva.
Highly recommended

Certainly we enjoyed our visit to the museum! A fascinating place with so much history to explore. The permanent exhibition on Olympic athletes, architects, and others are quite interesting. And seeing the Olympic game medals dating back to 1896 is indeed very impressive!

This hotel has a great location, great views and really good service with a friendly staff. It is across from the marina with a really nice view of the lake and the Alps in the distance. During my recent stay at the Mövenpick Hotel Lausanne, I found it to be a generally delightful experience, with a few small areas that could use improvement.

The location is absolutely stunning, offering breathtaking views of Lake Geneva and the surrounding mountains. It's also conveniently located, making it easy to explore the beautiful city of Lausanne.

The staff were consistently courteous and helpful, making check-in and check-out processes smooth and ensuring that any questions or needs were promptly addressed. Their dedication to providing excellent customer service was very much appreciated.

The room, while not particularly spacious, was convenient and perfect for a short stay. It was well-equipped with all the necessary amenities for a comfortable experience. However, I did notice that while the general cleanliness was satisfactory, it was not spotless. There were minor details, such as dust in less obvious areas and some bathroom fixtures that could have been cleaner.

The hotel's dining options were impressive, with a good variety of delicious dishes available. The dining area itself was spacious and comfortable. However, there was one notable issue at the live cooking station during breakfast. Unfortunately, the chef on duty was not pleasant or friendly and was, in fact, quite rude to a 15-year-old guest. This incident was disappointing and contrasted with the otherwise positive atmosphere of the hotel.

Overall, the Mövenpick Hotel Lausanne is a lovely place to stay, offering comfort and a prime location. With a bit more attention to cleanliness and some improvements in staff training, particularly for the live station chef, it could elevate the guest experience even further. I would certainly consider staying here again in the future.

The hotel is overall a very clean and the staff are friendly. That helps quite a lot. However the room comfort was not up to standard quality. It was below quality in my opinion. The air conditioning unit barely was blowing any form of air. You can sense something is coming out of the vents, however it's so slight that you really can't feel it overall in the room. I went to open the window to have some ventilation and air, however there were a lot of mosquitos every where. I requested a fan of which I received and I'm honestly thankful they did have it (I was considering buying one). So, I used the fan every night before I went to sleep to get some circulation of air into the room, so that solved the problem to an extent. As for the bathroom experience, it was overall fine and clean. However I had to deal extreme cold and hot temperatures at the same time. The water temperature kept fluctuating from extreme to extreme. After a while, I managed to find a pattern and stuck with it. Furthermore, the water pressure was very low, which meant I had to stay in the shower a bit longer than usual. The bed was very comfortable. I accepted that in the end, considering the rate I was paying was quite low, I accepted all the faults that I experienced. I didn't complain to the hotel. I didn't want to make a big issue out of it. I just was glad the checkout day came and that experience won't continue. If there's any recommendation I would give to the hotel, it would be to please stay in such rooms for a week and see how you feel in the end of it. Then, at least you will know which areas to improve.

My room was lovely.  The breakfast was great.  Our only problem was that the hotel was to have made dinner reservations for us for two nights.  The restaurants did not have reservations for us either night.

Our stay was wonderful and seamless! The staff is professional, polite, and very friendly. The location is magnificent and rooms are very well maintained and organized. Excellent service throughout the hotel and resturant. We most certainly recommend to all seeking a peaceful and seamless stay in Lausanne.

Everything was very nice. However, the doors and the floors/ceilings are not well sound proofed. We could hear people passing in the hallway and above our room there were guests making a lot of noise in one of the mornings, waking us up super early (before 8 am) when we were really looking forward to sleeping in. Other than that, all good!

Not my first stay. But I understand not all rooms are to same standard. When I get into the room, I saw 2 ants in the bathroom. But I saw no harm. But I woke up with one on my face and 2 in the bed. In the morning reception made a note and said to be informing housekeeping. When I arrive back to the room in teh afternoon, this time there was a large group of ants in my room & bathroom. My room was changed. I am sure housekeeping & reception did their best but it was not impossible that housekeeping did not notice them.

the room I was moved was not maintained in the same level as others. The light in the bathroom was not working.

I also eat dinner in the hotel restaurant for the first time. The service was incredibly slow and it took quite an effort to attract attention from the waiters.

Given the price/value level, one do not expect these.

We had a wonderful stay in the junior suite.  The bellboy, concierge, check in was seamless and the staff very friendly and kind.  It is unfortunate the hotel has in charge at the breakfast bar on 2nd June 11am such a dismissive and rude employee to customers trying to order a cup of hot chocolate and coffee.  Instead of acknowledging she has received the order, she says she is coming and proceeds to take her time to chat with the other customers after serving them their coffee, after a while we approached her and she responded by giving us a dirty look and still said she’s coming, as if we are bothering her chatting away.  It was clear her behavior towards us was with ill intent else she would not have been eventually arguing and aggressively reacting to us leaving.  Her demeanor is not coherent to the rest of the hotel staff whatsoever, unfortunately it has made our stay less pleasant than we were enjoying.

We enjoyed a Jr Suite on our recent trip to Lausanne. The reception desk personnel are fluent in French and English, at a minimum, and were very helpful. The room itself along with a beautiful view of Lake Geneva was excellent and included a complimentary minibar that was restocked daily, air conditioning, a small balcony, etc. It was by far the best room we stayed in on our two week trip to Switzerland.

The location on Lac Leman is hard to beat. The rooms are also nice, top class, as expected - only few have true lake view, though, and the other directions really aren't THAT special.

The check-in was not the best start - not the best room, quite rigid, didn't feel top class. But the service at the L'Accademia, the in-house restaurant, was nothing short of outstanding. Hats off to Viktor and the crew there - they made us (and our little daughter) feel welcome !
Hard to manage suitcases with steps and revolving door.   No staff available to assist.   Had a great time nevertheless and well worth the cost.  Good value.
My husband and I celebrated our Babymoon here and loved it! Highly recommend the Florissant building. Beautiful hotel, we are already planning our trip back.

The location was perfect - close to the Metro and the lake. The grounds and outside of the hotel are beautiful.

The rooms are a bit small however ours had a nice view of the pool and lake.  There are several areas that could use improvement:  We had to carry our own luggage up the outside stairs.  The room's air conditioner wasn't working so we called the front desk who reviewed the instructions to operate it which we had done correctly. She said someone would be sent up shortly to check. Over an hour later, someone came in only to verify we were correct in how to use the thermostat. We then had to wait 1 1/2 hours for someone else to come repair it. Once repaired it worked however we noticed an on-going noise every 20 seconds when on the High setting.  Adjusting it to the middle setting took care of the sound.

To end on a good note, the breakfast was wonderful and the serving staff were very helpful and friendly.

This hotel is a dream, from the wonderful pool area to the perfect blinds in the room (it‘s absolutely dark in the room), from the breath-taking interior (which is upkept perfectly) to the delicious breakfast - this hotel is the one in a million which you need to visit. Only small downgrade: service personnel seems to be a bit inexperienced. But overall, again, probably the best hotel in Switzerland!

We enjoyed our visit immensely!  Thank you to Isabelle for our fantastic room upgrade. The young man at reception was also exceptional, as was Juliette at the bar.  Our dinner at the Japanese restaurant was delicious and the service was excellent. We both have rated Beau Rivage Palace as our favourite hotel ever.

This hotel is a true masterpiece, a grand hotel in every sense. The service is unparalleled, consistently professional and friendly. The grounds are meticulously maintained, and the rooms, along with the spa and amenities, exude pure luxury. It was an absolute delight to get engaged here, creating our own cherished memories within the storied halls of this renowned hotel.

Beautiful hotel and well appointed amenities.  Would definitely stay here again - highly recommend this hotel.  Only feedback I have is that it would be nice if they did not start taking away the breakfast exactly at the time it is over and instead wait until the people in the breakfast room are done.

Stayed for a short Easter break with my young family. Two conjoining rooms worked well, overall impression of hotel is great, breakfast gave good quality and variety.
Spa is great but should be bigger for the size of the hotel.

1st floor room come with spacious balcony. Comes with 2 complimentary waters inside the fridge. Love the furnitures in the room and nice wallpaper.

There is one part of the carpet in front of the bathroom is wet for some reason. It is also not possible to adjust the heating as the system is centrally control, there are night where it’s quite cold. The pillow is too soft for me personally.
overall, the stay was OK, the hotel is really old. Need to be renovated. And the room is really old and many things were not working. The bed is good. you have to pay for the parking.

We stayed here for about a week last summer. It's a gorgeous property with very nice rooms. The rooms are lavishly decorated and equipped with air conditioning, if you need it. Each room comes with a balcony/terrace. Rooms on the first/second floor (the floor above ground level, it depends where you're from) have access to a much larger terrace which was a welcome surprise.

The elevator is quite small, but it's a historic building so it was expected.

Staff are very polite and were keen to offer directions or recommendations, and readily provided free transit passes for tourists from the city.
The location is great as it's just a few minutes from a metro stop, which makes the rest of the city very accessible as well, thanks to Lausanne's excellent public transit system.

Overall, an excellent hotel to spend a romantic escape for two, in one of Europe's finest cities.

Charming historic hotel walking distance from both the main train station and the lake. I like that the windows open, but am generally not a fan of carpeting in the hotel rooms. The faculty, comprising highly competent coaches and professors, demonstrates exceptional expertise. Having attended numerous institutions, I can confidently assert that IMD is among the finest. The Ouchy Lausanne embankment is a popular spot in Lausanne, Switzerland, known for its scenic views of Lake Geneva and the Alps. The walk is approximately 2 kilometers long and takes visitors through the beautiful Ouchy port and park, and towards the Olympic Museum.

Visitors to the embankment are treated to breathtaking views of the lake and mountains, which are particularly stunning during the sunset. The promenade is also well maintained and clean, making it an enjoyable and comfortable walk for visitors of all ages. The park surrounding the embankment is also a popular spot for picnics, jogging, and cycling.

Overall, the Ouchy Lausanne embankment is a must-visit spot for anyone traveling to Lausanne.
